results.title: Bonsai: the art of training dwarfed potted trees
results.brief_description: An examination of Bonsai with some background on its origins. In this film prize specimens of Bonsai are viewed, trees are observed in their natural state and step-by-step demonstrations of the art and technique are shown.

results.title: Bones and muscles (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Young Japanese athletes create awareness of how the human skeletal and muscular systems work together to allow movement of the body. A frog specimen shows how the muscles in the upper arm contract and relax so that arm bones can be moved. Discusses the functions of tendons, cartilage, and ligaments and examines various bones, joints, and vertebrae.

results.title: Bonds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
This film describes why different types of bonds are used and proceeds to demonstrate various bonds. It explains that “bonding” means to arrange bricks to a definite pattern according to function. A wall in “Flemish” bond is shown and its construction demonstrated in a one brick and a one and a half brick wall. “English” bond is then dealt with followed by “Dutch” bond. English and Flemish garden wall bonds bring the film to a close.

results.title: Bombay milk scheme
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: To improve the supply and quality of milk in Bombay, the Government began construction in 1948 of a dairy farm and passed a law requiring that all cattle herds be moved outside the city limits. The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations sent an expert in animal husbandry and a dairy technologist to work with local officials and experts.

results.title: Bombay: gateway to India
results.brief_description: This film features the tourist attractions of Bombay and the surrounding district including the India Gate, the city and harbour, the view from Malabar Hill, public buildings, street entertainers, the harbour, and Elephanta Island with its ancient cave temples.

results.title: Body language in the classroom (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Wylam, Aaron Wolfgang and International Telefilm Enterprises
results.brief_description: Encourages teachers to be aware of body language and shows how it can be applied in the classroom. Offers suggestions on nonverbal behavior for improving communication, including gesturing, pointing, increased eye contact, and other techniques.

results.title: Body defences against disease
results.brief_description: This film is an exposition of the human body’s three lines of defence against disease: the skin, the phagocytic cells and lymphatics, and the blood. Types of antibodies and their effect, the action of the liver and the spleen, and the application of a defence mechanism in specific cases are studied in detail. Immunology is also studies, and microphotography shows us phagocytosis.

results.title: The Bob Knowlton story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Swerdloff, Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Productions
results.brief_description: Based on a case study by Dr Alex Bavelas and written by Bernard Fein and Malvin Wald. This instructional film focuses on communication, productivity, performance and staff management including team work and leadership roles.
